fields.description:
I found it odd that all the responses have things like: <projects expand="projects"> <projects> ... </projects></projects>

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=41899&tstart=0
fields.summary: REST API have responses with double names

fields.description:
It would be excellent to have EC2 Images with IE7 and IE8 for Selenium testing.

A few concerns:
* Build system changes
* Security on the Windows hosts
** Need some way to RDP to the host without the ec2 images having the same user/pass
* Windows 2003 Server security needs to be tuned to Windows XP level (Selenium will break if the Security Zones are not configured correctly)
* Windows software updates
* Should we install Firefox 2/3 and Google Chrome?
fields.summary: Elastic Images for Windows 2003 with IE7 and IE8 for Selenium

fields.description:
Problem is only with the *Build Log*, normal artifacts have the correct URL.

https://bamboo.community.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/build/CONFTRIGGER-TRUNK?expand=builds[0].build.artifacts

Note missing / before *download*:
{code:xml}
<artifact>
<name>Build log</name>
<link rel="self" href="http://bamboo.community.atlassian.comdownload/CONFTRIGGER-TRUNK/buildSummary_logs/CONFTRIGGER-TRUNK-1553.log"/>
</artifact>
{code}
fields.summary: REST API missing / in url for build log artifact

fields.description:
Navigate to:

https://gdansk.bamboo2.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/build?favourite&expand=builds.build

You get 

{code:xml}
<status>
    <status-code>500</status-code>
    <message>Path segment is null</message>
</status>
{code}

This used to work on previous version of that server

fields.description:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257334269

Essentially we need to put the plugin:available="true" on the notificationDispatcher and create an interface for it in bamboo-api, so people can use it without depending on the entire bamboo stack.
fields.summary: Fix the notificationDispatcher to play nice with plugins 2.0 plugins

fields.description:
I was surprised to find that Bamboo's System Info page does not contain the Bamboo version number.  Sometimes (as in JIRA Studio) the footer does not list the Bamboo version, and hence we need it here.

For inspiration, here is what JIRA shows:

{noformat}
JIRA Info
  Uptime 	4 days, 5 hours, 55 minutes, 28 seconds
  Edition 	enterprise
  Version 	4.0.1
  Build Number 	471
  Build Date 	Tue Dec 08 00:00:00 PST 2009
  Atlassian Partner 	
  Installation Type 	unknown
  Server ID 	XG37-S3ER-QM4W-6VEE
  Installed languages 	
  Default language 	English (United States) - System Default
{noformat}
fields.summary: Add Bamboo version to System Information page

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+REST+Resources#BambooRESTResources-BuildQueueService

*returns error code 500*
* wget --http-user=admin --http-password=admin  --post-data '' http://localhost:8080/bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/CHILD-SCR?os_authType=basic
* wget --http-user=admin --http-password=admin --post-data '/queue/CHILD-SCR'  http://localhost:8080/bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/CHILD-SCR?os_authType=basic
* wget --http-user=admin --http-password=admin   http://localhost:8080/bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/CHILD-SCR?os_authType=basic

Also examples are needed to clarify the use of methods.

I was not able to find a DELETE method for wget.

How would you use POST and DELETE from the command line and from the browser

fields.description:
A user reports that the Ant ftp task fails with:

Could not create type ftp due to java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/commons/net/ftp/FTPClientConfig

and the scp task fails with:

{noformat}
Problem: failed to create task or type scp
Cause: Could not load a dependent class com/jcraft/jsch/UserInfo
It is not enough to have Ant's optional JARs
you need the JAR files that the optional tasks depend upon.
Ant's optional task dependencies are listed in the manual.
Action: Determine what extra JAR files are needed, and place them in one of:
-/opt/apache-ant-1.7.1/lib
-/home/bamboo/.ant/lib
-a directory added on the command line with the -lib argument

Do not panic, this is a common problem.
The commonest cause is a missing JAR.

This is not a bug; it is a configuration problem

Total time: 0 seconds
{noformat}

Per the [Ant dependencies|http://ant.apache.org/manual/install.html#librarydependencies] it would be good if we included the required jars for these.
fields.summary: Provide jsch libraries in elastic default image so Ant scp works

The ampersand is encoded wrong and the page produces a NPE

fields.description:
While I was creating a plan, I changed my mind about which Maven 2 version my plan should use.  When I went to the requirements screen again, the new Maven 2 requirement had been added, but the previous Maven 2.1.0 requirement was also still there.  I tried changing it to Maven 2.2 and the problem was repeated.

After I saved the build I was then able to change the builder again and the extra requirements were removed (one at a time each time I changed the builder).
fields.summary: Previous builder requirements are not removed during build creation

fields.description:
1) Create a SVN repository with the following history
Revison 2 is a copy from branch1 to branch 2:
# svn cp -m '* break bamboo' file:///repo/branch1 file:///repo/branch2

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r2 | apache | 2010-03-01 18:25:36 +0100 (Mon, 01 Mar 2010) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /branch2 (from /branch1:1)

* break bamboo
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1 | apache | 2010-03-01 18:25:06 +0100 (Mon, 01 Mar 2010) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /branch1
   A /branch1/dir
   A /branch1/dir/file.txt

create structure
------------------------------------------------------------------------

2) Create a buildplan that checkes out the "/branch2/dir" SVN directory

3) Make 2 manual builds

4) Enjoy: Bamboo checks out revision 1 instead of 2
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21  	Build DEMOHEAD-DEF-3 started building on agent Default Agent
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21 	Running preRetrieveSourceCode task...
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21 	Build always require a clean checkout
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21 	Cleaning build directory '<STRIPPED>/bamboo/home/xml-data/build-dir/DEMOHEAD-DEF'
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21 	Updating source code to revision: 1
01-Mar-2010 18:27:21 	Working directory '<STRIPPED>/bamboo/home/xml-data/build-dir/DEMOHEAD-DEF' is empty. Checking out SVN URL 'file:///<STRIPPED>/branch2/dir'
01-Mar-2010 18:27:22 	Error occurred while executing the build for DEMOHEAD-DEF-3 : Failed to checkout source code to revision '1' for <STRIPPED>/branch2/dir

NOTE: Failed build number is "3" because of Bamboo runs manual builds twice sometimes. Build 1 and 2 were both triggered by the initial build and are based on rev 2. All future manual builds fail during the checkout phase and are based on rev 1. Commiting a change beneath the "/branch2/dir" directory fixes the buildplan.
fields.summary: SVN checkouts are not based on the global repository revision number

fields.description:
It'd be great for Bamboo to support Hg as a first-class citizen, built-in to Bamboo. The [third-party plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5942] is out-of-date and appears to not longer be maintained. Mercurial support in Bamboo would complement FE-530.

Hg is shaping up as a key contender to replace SVN for us.
fields.summary: Add support for Mercurial scm

fields.description:
As described in BAM-5337 the Recent Builds tab of the viewAgent.action only ever displays the most recent 15 builds.  However, it suggests to me as a user that the agent has only run 15 builds.  The strongest misleading hint is the pagination.

It says 1-15 of 15 and has disabled buttons for navigating to other pages.  Why would those buttons be there if it is impossible for there to be more than 15 builds?

Please either allow more pages to be displayed or remove the pagination button.
Adding text saying "The 15 most recent builds" somewhere on the screen would also be helpful.

fields.summary: Allow user to see more of an agent's build history

fields.description:
We have a bamboo instance in one physical location and often we would like to place a remote agent on some server which is part of the intranet in some other location. The problem is that although the remote agent can see the bamboo server, the bamboo server can't see the remote agent because it doesn't have a public IP.

We have this need all the time.

I guess this could be made possible if instead of the bamboo server sending the build information to the agent, it was the agent that polled that information from the queue. That way we wouldn't need bi-directional communication between the server and agent. This behaviour could be for example activated with a flag in the remote agent startup.
fields.summary: Support remote agents not visible from server host

fields.description:
Jquery Tabs converts our Builder and JDK labels to html friendly ID's. This can mean that you end up with two different capabilities having the same tab id.  Eg. Maven 1 and Maven_1 will end up the same.

*The consequences:*  
* Normal use of the page is fine, jqeury will happily switch between the tabs and populate them with the correct data.
* Hitting the duplicated tab directly (via a url) will always pick the first one e.g http://myUrl#Maven_1 cause it can't tell the difference between the two - this behaviour whilst not as user friendly, is still okay.
* If you directly hit any tab which appears after the duplicate tabs thing start to break and the content does not get unhidden (the html is actually there)(see screenshot1).  If you click on the offending duplicate it will show the content of the new tab but say the old tab is still selected.  You can not actually reselect the old tab (see screenshot2).  If you then click any other tab above the duplicate.  It all fixes it self up and the page can be used as normal.  This seems to be a bug in jquery.

*The workaround*
* Just click another tab and your back to normal
* If its too annoying you can rename the capability to make the id's differ. It uses this regex to calculate the id's based on the capabilities label: label.replace(/\s/g, '_').replace(/[^A-Za-z0-9\-_:\.]/g, '')
fields.summary: Wierd behaviour with identical ids on Builders and JDKs Pages

fields.description:
Anton likes the suggestion of adding some monitoring stuff. Ideally a job that every X (e.g. 20) seconds checks size of the queue and logs some warnings if the queue is bigger than Y (e.g. 100). If the queue is bigger than Y for Z (e.g. 10) minutes then send a thread dump to the logs as well.

It would be good if X, Y, Z are system properties (maybe defined the Spring way).

That way if customers do start having slowness problems we should be able to get some decent information as to whats causing it and the best possible ways to fix it.
fields.summary: Monitoring for the BambooEventManager

fields.description:
From: https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-997#c17472

Chai:
Is there any reason why we wouldn't simply store the calculated values? One of the things was that size was not calculated for directories in fear that it was going to be too expensive (which it can be if artifacts are big). Thoughts?

Krystian:
If we decide to persist the url then we shall remember to update it once the buildKey will get changed (build move) which in my opinion adds complexity. We can however store a path with some kind of token to be replaced by planKey while property is being read ("/browse/%s/artifacts/build-123/whatever")
If you want to persist artifact size as well, then we might calculate directory size (as it would be done once).

Chai:
Yeah for URL we could just store the calculated suffix (ie the thing that requires us to browse for an index.html etc) and leave out the prefix (that can just be apended, it's not expensive)
+ we should store the full size for the directory, though it'd be good to do some testing to see if how much more time it adds (say for a Clover report over JIRA is a good test)
fields.summary: Persist some calculated data for ArtifactLink

fields.description:
I received a hung build message for a slow running build, saying the build had run overtime and no log messages had been received for 41 minutes.  While on that page I saw the log refresh and realised the "log messages" statement was incorrect.  The build was very long running, but it wasn't hung, and the hung build message persisted even though the log kept being updated.  Refreshing the activity page did not correct the message.  Screenshot of the warning is attached.  
Actual build log is at https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC3-CLUST5MYSQLR-1321.  It did take a *really* long time.
fields.summary: Incorrect hung build warning

fields.description:
During plan creation a

com.atlassian.bamboo.exception.DataAccessException: org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException: org.w3c.dom.DOMException: INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR:

is thrown when the plan permission configuration contain a user name or group name with a space.
User and group names with withspace are ok in LDAP for example.

To reproduce:
# create a group name with a space like "bamboo administrator" in ldap
# connect bamboo to ldap
# create a plan, add above group in the permissions screen
# BANG
fields.summary: cannot create plan when plan permissions configuration contains user or group name with whitespace

fields.description:
I was moving build plans to a different project on BEAC, and the text on screen gave the following:

{panel}It is strongly recommended that you ensure that all agents are disabled before you perform the move. {color:blue}+Disable all agents+{color}{panel}

I clicked on this, expecting that there would be an easy way to re-enable all the agents after I had finished moving my plan. But here wasn't.

Either:
* The UI should include an "Are you sure you want to do this" screen, with a warning and explanation of what will happen
* There should be an easy step after the move to re-enable the agents
* The recommendation shouldn't be given at all, and Bamboo should just enforce that only disabled builds can be moved
fields.summary: Usability: Bamboo UI 'strongly recommends' users to disable all agents when moving build plans
Tests for Eucalytus support

fields.description:
About a week ago, a test Bamboo installation I have set up on a Windows 2003 server started to have an error when trying to browse to it, both from the local machine it is installed on and remotely. I have also tried using both IE and Firefox. The error started when 1.0-rc1 had been in use for a while and still exists after an upgrade to rc2. 

On thing that may be a factor is licences. If the test licences for beta copies last 30 days, it could be the case that the licence I am using has run out. However, the error doesn't give an indication this is the case and Bamboo still seems to be running build plans. The email with my licence key in it doesn't provide information as to when the licence is valid until.

When trying to browse to http://host:8085, IE gives an error saying "The page cannot be displayed". Firefox gives a more detailed error:

===============
The page isn't redirecting properly
Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this address in a way that will never complete.
*  This problem can sometimes be caused by disabling or refusing to accept
    cookies.
===============

*Workaround:*

# Shutdown Bamboo.
# Edit <Bamboo-Home>/bamboo.cfg.xml file and find the following line, {code}
          <property name="license.string">YOUR_CURRENT_LICENSE_KEY</property>
      {code}
# Replace the line with,
      {code}
          <property name="license.string">YOUR_NEW_LICENSE_KEY</property>
      {code}
# Restart Bamboo.

*PS* You also need to escape < and > characters in XML file. If you have < in your license key use {{<}} and for > use  {{>}}
fields.summary: Redirection error when browsing to Bamboo pages when licence is expired
Test Label Indexes on MySQL

fields.description:
At the moment, the # of recently completed builds is hard-coded to 15:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=41213&tstart=0

It would be far more useful if the user could define in the Bamboo GUI exactly how many recently completed builds they wanted to see. There are already arrows at the base of the recently completed builds list that under normal circumstances would suggest you can see the next/previous and first/last set of 15 builds. As it is, they're misleading.
fields.summary: Allow user to specify # of builds listed in "recently completed  builds" list on current activity dashboard

fields.description:
Currently if the evaluation license expires you will get redirected to the update license page.  If however you are a normal user (not an admin user) you will just get a permission denied exception on the screen, because they don't have the permissions to update the license. 

They should get taken to a nice screen saying - Sorry your license has expired please contact and administrator to update the license.
fields.summary: Make the redirect less ugly for a non-admin user when evaluation license expires

Jira Studio Bamboo users are only allowed to build on elastic agents (...ick)

It make bamboo studio more user friendly if phpunit would be part of the default image.
fields.summary: Elastic Default Image should have PHPunit installed

fields.description:
Builds can fail with optimised clover builds when you select the "Build will product test results" option

If you enable test optimisation with clover, and clover detects that no tests need to be run, the bamboo build fails because no test results will be generated in that case.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100212-ftx1bmf922ynd3m2cff8hkf221.jpg! 

Its not really an error since it would be the expected result in this case. 

The workaround is to not produce the test results for optimised build plans, and only do it for full builds.
fields.summary: Allow builds to parse test results but not fail when no test results found

fields.description:
A build hung, apparently because its parent was in the queue.  This message was reported three times:
bq. Triggering for this build was blocked because its parent 'x' was already in the queue
Then the build sat there eternally.

Why should a parent build being queued prevent a child build from runnning?
I googled the first half of the phrase and searched confluence.atlassian.com for it and there were no matches.  If this isn't a bug it at least needs some documentation
fields.summary: Build blocked (hung) because parent is queued

fields.description: I have a handful of parent poms that our organization uses. I have bamboo building these parent poms, mainly so the snapshot is deployed when changes are made. The maven 2 dependency management does not take into account a dependency on a parent corporate pom when it is a snapshot, so all projects that depend on that parent pom are not triggered to do a new build.
fields.summary: Maven dependencies should take into account parent poms

If however, you navigate to this page by clicking the "Add builder to server capabilities" on the builders page (and similarly on jdk's page) the item is not highlighted. fields.description:
BAM-5006, a customer request, resulted in ${bamboo.custom.svn.revision.number} no longer meaning the latest revision in the repository, but the latest change revision.  While I can see the use case that make the latter interesting, this breaks our configuration, as we have multiple bamboo builds that are fed into a central one.

For example, we have a module A build (FOO-A) and a module B bamboo build (FOO-B).  FOO-B is a dependent of FOO-A.  Each has a separate location of a shared svn repository.

If the repository is at revision 5, we build the works:
* FOO-A = svn r5
* FOO-B = svn r5

Now we update a file for FOO-A and rebuild.  We get inconsistent results:
* FOO-A = svn r6
* FOO-B = svn r5

It looks like B hasn't consumed A's changes... but it has.  It also makes FOO-B look like a duplicate build with no changes, when it isn't.

Consider restoring this behavior of ${bamboo.custom.svn.revision.number} and adding something like ${bamboo.custom.svn.lastchange.revision.number}
fields.summary: Revert BAM-5006 - it has broken the functionality of ${bamboo.custom.svn.revision.number}

fields.description:
RemoteElasticInstanceImpl.getID() is called regularly in Bamboo. If any of the supervising threads are working getting the instance id will lock.

Fix here is to make ID volatile and not synchronized which will avoid the UI from blocking when going to the instances page if the supervisor threads are taking their time.  Bamboo considers instances with a null ID to be not setup correctly and can handle this case correctly.

Attached is the thread dump taken from Panda this morning.
fields.summary: Deadlock in RemoteElasticInstanceImpl

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Deploy JIRA 4.0.1 WAR into Tomcat 5.5.26
# Deploy Bamboo 2.5.1 WAR into same Tomcat
# Configure everything normally
# Start up JIRA. Default configuration. Create TST project.
# Start up Bamboo. Express Installation.
# In JIRA, configure a Bamboo Server for the Bamboo app
# Shutdown Tomcat
# Restart Tomcat

Bamboo gets this far:

{quote}
2010-02-04 16:06:03,522 INFO [main] [BambooSmackClient] No IM server specified. Bambo Smack client not initiated.
2010-02-04 16:06:03,573 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: completedBuildNotificationEventListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,591 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: afterXFailedNotificationListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,597 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: buildCommentedNotificationListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,601 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: buildHungNotificationListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,605 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: buildQueueTimeoutNotificationListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,608 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: legacyNotificationEventListener
2010-02-04 16:06:03,612 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Registered Event Listener: buildErrorNotificationListener

2010-02-04 16:06:03,634 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Bamboo version 2.5.1 initialised OK
2010-02-04 16:06:03,634 INFO [main] [BambooContainer] Using bamboo.home: /Users/mtokar/support/JSP-51856/bamboohome
2010-02-04 16:06:03,636 INFO [main] [AccessLogFilter] AccessLogFilter initialized. Format is: <user> <url> <starting memory free (kb)> +- <difference in free mem (kb)> <query time (ms)>
2010-02-04 16:06:03,642 INFO [main] [[/bamboo]] org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.utils.Log ERROR: logLevelConf: null
2010-02-04 16:06:03,665 INFO [main] [[/bamboo]] org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.UrlRewriteFilter INFO: loaded (conf ok)
2010-02-04 16:06:03,748 INFO [main] [[/bamboo]]  [CompressingFilter/1.4] CompressingFilter has initialized
{quote}

JIRA initialisation gets this far:

{quote}

Database configuration OK

___ Database Configuration _______

     Loading entityengine.xml from       : file:/Users/mtokar/support/JSP-51856/apache-tomcat-5.5.26/webapps/jira/WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml
     Entity model data source name       : defaultDS
     Entity model field type name        : hsql
     Entity model schema name            : PUBLIC
     Database Version                    : HSQL Database Engine - 1.8.0
     Database Driver                     : HSQL Database Engine Driver - 1.8.0
     Database URL                        : jdbc:hsqldb:/Users/mtokar/support/JSP-51856/atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0.1/database/jiradb
     Database JNDI address               : java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS
{quote}

Tomcat logs show that Tomcat has hung after the plugins system has been initialised:

{quote}
4/02/2010 16:06:17 com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.UnrecognizedModuleDescriptorServiceTrackerCustomizer addingService
INFO: Turned plugin module com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:streamsActivityProvider into module com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:streamsActivityProvider (null)
4/02/2010 16:06:26 com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader loadAllPlugins
INFO: No plugins found to be deployed
4/02/2010 16:06:26 com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager init
INFO: Plugin system started in 0:00:19.183
{quote}

Neither JIRA or Bamboo webapps can be accessed through the browser. Thread dump of Tomcat shows the following stack trace:

{quote}
Thread t@81667: (state = IN_NATIVE)
 - java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(java.io.FileDescriptor, byte[], int, int, int) @bci=0 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.net.SocketInputStream.read(byte[], int, int) @bci=84, line=129 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill() @bci=175, line=218 (Compiled frame)
 - java.io.BufferedInputStream.read() @bci=12, line=235 (Compiled frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpParser.readRawLine(java.io.InputStream) @bci=36, line=77 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpParser.readLine(java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String) @bci=11, line=105 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.readLine(java.lang.String) @bci=19, line=1115 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$HttpConnectionAdapter.readLine(java.lang.String) @bci=12, line=1373 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.readStatusLine(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpState, org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection) @bci=36, line=1832 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.readResponse(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpState, org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection) @bci=16, line=1590 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.execute(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpState, org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection) @bci=68, line=995 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethod) @bci=138, line=397 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethod) @bci=291, line=170 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HostConfiguration, org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethod, org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpState) @bci=115, line=396 (Interpreted frame)
 - org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethod) @bci=14, line=324 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.BambooServerManagerImpl.isGadgetAvailable(java.net.URI) @bci=17, line=413 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.BambooServerManagerImpl.addGadgetsForServer(com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.service.BambooServer) @bci=63, line=376 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.bamboo.BambooServerManagerImpl.start() @bci=36, line=117 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.sal.jira.lifecycle.JiraLifecycleManager.notifyOnStart() @bci=99, line=83 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.sal.core.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleManager.start() @bci=15, line=50 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.atlassian.sal.jira.lifecycle.JiraLifecycleManager.onJiraStart(com.atlassian.jira.extension.JiraStartedEvent) @bci=9, line=60 (Interpreted frame)
{quote}

So what we have is a deadlock. Bamboo is somewhat started up but not responding to HTTP requests. JIRA has started its plugins, and in the starting of the JIRA Bamboo Plugin, some code tries to eagerly instantiate something in {{BambooServerManagerImpl.java}}:

{code}
    protected boolean isGadgetAvailable(URI uri)
    {
        HeadMethod method = new HeadMethod(uri.toString());
        try
        {
            httpClient.executeMethod(method);
            return method.getStatusCode() < HTTP_STATUS_CODE_ERRORS;
        }
        catch(IOException e)
        {
            return false;
        }
        finally
        {
           method.releaseConnection();
        }
    }
{code}

i.e. JIRA is waiting on Bamboo to respond.

This should be fixed so that the attempted HTTP connection at least has a sensible timeout (60seconds?) before it gives up and moves along. That, or instantiate things not on the startup of a plugin but at a different point in the lifecycle.
fields.summary: JIRA Bamboo Plugin creates deadlock in JIRA and Bamboo applications when starting them up in the same Tomcat server

fields.description:

Though the easiest option is to set tabindex="-1" on the hidden buttons.
fields.summary: Remove hidden buttons and use CSS to position the buttons OR make hidden buttons untabbable

fields.description: Attached is a screenshot of what happens when your session has timed out and you go back then forward - appears after about 5-10 seconds
fields.summary: Session timeout and refreshing of Latest Status bar causes decorated login screen to appear inside page rather than taking up whole page

fields.description:
According to other bug reports
http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNGECLIPSE-124 and http://issues.jfrog.org/jira/browse/MDV-51 the maven embedder
(and bamboo's maven import) fails if the default $HOME/.m2 directory is not present or set to a different location 
in <maven-install>/conf/settings.xml

To reproduce:

# move ~/.m2 out of the way (rename)
# import mvn pom
fields.summary: Maven embedder throws exception if $USER/.m2 is not existing or in a different location

fields.description: From the accesslogs, clicking any item on the drop down menu seems to fire off two requests
fields.summary: Clicking an item on the Builds menu run fire off two requests

fields.description:
If bamboo is behind a forward proxy bamboo cannot connect to the 'outside' world such as EC2 AWS instances, external jira instances...
Bamboo should connect with the help of [proxy settings|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/deployment/deployment-guide/proxie_config.html] that can be specified at startup or through the ui under general settings.
fields.summary: Support java proxy connection to EC2

fields.description:
UserMapper runs through each _visible_ user to check for conditions - mainly personalization.
If a large external repo is connected this takes hours. 99.99% of the users have nothing to do with bamboo and are not stored in the export.
The way whether a user needs to be added to the export should not be determined on a user by user basis.
The export trigger/criteria such as personalisations, mail format settings, IM settings should be scanned and affected users added.
fields.summary: export with external repo 100.000+ users takes too long

fields.description:
As a corporate customer, please add support for Eucalyptus so that can we can utilize and benefit from Elastic Bamboo running in a private cloud

Elastic Bamboo is great for open source projects, but commercial/enterprise software products may have intellectual property policies and source control access restrictions which prevents the running of builds in public cloud spaces.  

- Eucalyptus Home: http://forum.eucalyptus.com/
- Bamboo uses the Typica library to interact with AWS, and Typica v1.6 reportedly supports Eucalyptus:  http://groups.google.com/group/typica/browse_thread/thread/4298336e27d54a4f

Adding Eucalyptus support would be greatly appreciated!
fields.summary: Eucalyptus Support

I encountered this problem, as today my Connector for Eclipse open my web browser on this link when I wanted to see selected build. Interestingly, repeating the same action in IDE Connector resulted in valid URL (without encoded "&"). Anyway, others may have the same problem and NPE is not very good :)
fields.summary: NPE when & is included in the request
